text: this is our 38th year for the convention
we have 45 contestants from 14 foreign
countries and 24 states I always like to
say that you know I wanted to be best in
the world at something
two years ago at the International
whistlers convention in Lewisburg North
Carolina Luke Janssen who had never
competed there before was crowned the
grand champion of whistling they had a
competition in 2010 in China which would
have quite liked to have gone to but I
was having a baby daughter so I missed
that one his unusual style called palate
or throat whistling captivated judges
and stunned whistling sold guards had
the sort of idea that whistling used to
once be wants to be cool and I think
over the years it's become a bit put on
a clown suit and whistle and one day
maybe a maybe I could I could make it
cooler yet now after taking a year off
he's going back to North Carolina to
regain his title but this time he
confronts new judges and will face stiff
competition including from a fellow New
Yorker
I've done the today show twice I've done
the CBS point early morning three times
I've done Fox and Friends my name is
Steve herbst professionally I'm known as
Steve the whistle herbs I turned
professional in 1995 when I was on Live
with Regis and Kathie Lee i was born in
New York City and I've lived in
Manhattan now for 33 years I've had
people follow me four blocks like a Pied
Piper and we'd get to a stoplight and
something was saying and I can't believe
what I'm hearing I can't believe my ears
you know 2011 I'm going down not having
competed for two years look I would love
to win you can't take it for granted too
just because you're an old hand of you
know you've got the big edge on anybody
so most people when they whistle whistle
you know about what they call a
Pakistani whistling so they'll put their
lips together and blow I'll make the
sound with my tongue in the roof of my
mouth so you have all the rest of your
mouth to manipulate you know that the
sound so if you whistle inside your
mouth like this you can use your your
lips to make it sound like this
because they're allowing me to whistle
in that way I've got a little bit of an

as long as I don't mean to mess anything
up I should prevail with both women's
and men's divisions whistlers compete in
a preliminary round performing one
classical in one pop song I think it's
important to go out there is a woman and
really showcase what was Lincoln do not
only that i'm a very powerful whistler
so that kind of i think is sort of an
extra statement of saying like hey I'm a
woman and I'm not delicate I'm here I'm
making a statement and I've got music
for you the judges you know oak left a
train so you know for them it's
important that you get the notes ridin
that they're in tune and then the tone
is right I think it sort of depends what

think fairly squarely in the new

we are slightly older there are

parker style is always you know been the

comfortable with for the preliminary
round and saving things that I haven't
done a long time were even new stuff for
the finals
after the preliminary rounds both Luke
Jansen and Steve herbst advance to the

then I pulled out the big guns for the

stairway to heaven
mr. Luke Johnson from New York the
